required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate Health Coaching Support in Technology-based Interventions for Meeting Health Goals
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluate Health Coaching Support in Technology-based Interventions for Goal Setting (PEC 15-470)

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: In this trial, the investigators will examine whether text messages sent to Veterans will help support in meeting nutrition or physical activity health goals. All participants will get text messages over two month to support their goal.

detailed_description.textblock:
Trial is suspended due to COVID-19.
The investigators are preparing to conduct a one-group pilot trial evaluating Veterans who receive automated text messaging. Completion of this pilot trial will provide preliminary insights regarding efficacy and feasibility of a text messaging program on self-efficacy, goal commitment, and health confidence. It will also provide data on how best to incorporate health coaching into the adoption and use of connected care technologies for health behavior and behavior change.

primary_outcome.measure: Self-efficacy: Healthful eating via Revised Eating Self-Efficacy Scale (ESES-R)
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported confidence in performing healthful diet and physical activity behaviors. Self-efficacy - Healthful eating via Revised Eating Self-Efficacy Scale (ESES-R). Range: 1-10; higher values represent a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Goal commitment: Healthful eating via the Hollenbeck, Williams, and Klein Goal Commitment Scale
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported commitment to healthful diet and physical activity goals. Goal commitment - Healthful eating via the Hollenbeck, Williams, and Klein Goal Commitment Scale. Range: 1-5; higher values represent a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Self-efficacy: Physical activity via the Self-efficacy for Exercise Behaviors Scale
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported confidence in performing healthful diet and physical activity behaviors. Self-efficacy - Physical activity via the Self-efficacy for Exercise Behaviors Scale. Range: 1-5; higher values represent a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Goal commitment: Physical activity via the Hollenbeck, Williams, and Klein Goal Commitment Scale
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported commitment to healthful diet and physical activity goals. Goal commitment - Physical activity via the Hollenbeck, Williams, and Klein Goal Commitment Scale. Range: 1-5; higher values represent a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health confidence: the Health Confidence Score
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported confidence in patient engagement. Health Confidence. Range: 0-12; higher values represent a better outcome.

arm_group.description: Participants receive text messages about healthy eating or physical activity.

intervention.description: Two months of daily text messages to support meeting a health goal

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient at designated VA site
- Ownership of a cellular phone
- Over age 18
- Pre-screened by their primary care physician for study inclusion for medical contraindication to physical activity and diet change
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient outside designated VA site
- Non-ownership of a cellular phone
- Under age 18
- Not pre-screened by their primary care physician for study inclusion for medical contraindication to physical activity and diet change or deemed ineligible to participate by primary care physician

overall_official.last_name: Timothy Patrick Hogan, PhD MS BS
overall_official.affiliation: Edith Nourse Rogers Memorial Veterans Hospital, Bedford, MA
